intro: Galium inflatum, commonly known as the inflated bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers in clusters, typically blooming from late spring to early autumn. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Galium inflatum is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
